location.distanceFromPark: 8 miles to Grand Teton National Park

content.description: Jackson Hole's ultimate family destination since 1966, Calico offers the perfect combination of great Italian-American food and a massive 1.5-acre lawn where kids can play safely while parents dine on the outdoor deck. This beloved Wilson institution features hand-thrown pizzas, locally-sourced dishes, and an atmosphere where families can truly relax.
highlights: 1.5-acre fenced lawn with game balls - kids can play while parents eat
Operating since 1966 - Jackson Hole's oldest family restaurant tradition
Hand-thrown pizzas made fresh with local, sustainable ingredients
Large outdoor deck perfect for families in summer months
Locally raised, grass-fed beef and free-range organic chicken
tips: Summer is peak season - the outdoor lawn and deck are what make this special
Perfect spot for families - kids can burn energy while parents enjoy dinner
Try the famous bruschetta and homemade lasagna
Located in Wilson - more relaxed than busy Jackson restaurants
Great for large family groups and celebrations

images.alt: Calico Restaurant outdoor deck with kids playing on large lawn
images.caption: Family paradise with 1.5 acres for kids to play

location.distanceFromPark: 5 miles to Grand Teton National Park

dining.reservations: first come, first served - no reservations

content.description: Wyoming's oldest and America's most award-winning small craft brewery doubles as one of Jackson's best family restaurants. The large, high-ceilinged space features a designated family dining area upstairs, game room, outdoor lawn with cornhole, and hearty comfort food that satisfies both kids and adults after outdoor adventures.
highlights: Wyoming's oldest craft brewery - 12 award-winning beers on tap
Designated family dining area upstairs away from bar crowd
Famous Wyoming bison & beef chili and wood-fired pizzas
Large outdoor lawn with cornhole and casual seating
Weekend brunch with $25 bottomless bloody marys and mimosas
tips: Upstairs dining area is more family-friendly than main floor bar
No reservations - arrive early during peak times
Perfect after hiking or skiing - hearty portions for hungry families
Kids love the game room and outdoor lawn activities
Local favorite - great place to experience authentic Jackson atmosphere

images.alt: Snake River Brewing family dining area with mountain views
images.caption: Local brewpub with family-friendly upstairs dining

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park

content.description: Located in the beautifully restored historic Teton Theater (built 1941), Hand Fire Pizza offers families a unique dining experience watching chefs create 100% wood-fired pizzas in an open kitchen. The spacious two-story venue easily accommodates large families and groups, with kids fascinated by the theater setting and pizza-making process.
highlights: Historic 1941 Teton Theater restored with original marquee and ticket booth
100% wood-fired oven with open kitchen - kids love watching pizza making
Organic, locally-sourced ingredients with gluten-free and vegan options
Sprawling space perfect for large families - can accommodate up to 250 guests
Tuesday 'Pizza for a Purpose' nights supporting local non-profits
tips: Kids are mesmerized watching the open kitchen and wood-fired oven
Historic theater setting makes this a unique Jackson experience
Great for large family groups - one of few restaurants that handles big parties well
Try The Meatbawls pizza - made with local Jackson Hole Hereford Ranch beef
Use waitlist system online or call 30-40 minutes before arrival

images.alt: Hand Fire Pizza historic theater interior with wood-fired oven
images.caption: Pizza theater in the historic 1941 Teton Theater

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park

content.description: Housed in a historic 1906 log cabin just one block from Town Square, Cafe Genevieve serves 'inspired home cooked classics' that bring Southern comfort food to Wyoming. This cozy family favorite features outdoor dining under 110-year-old cottonwood trees and is famous for its Pig Candy bacon and family-friendly atmosphere.
highlights: Historic 1906 log cabin - one of Jackson's few remaining original residential structures
Famous 'Pig Candy' bacon that kids and adults love
Featured on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
Beautiful outdoor patio dining under century-old cottonwood trees
Southern-inspired comfort food made with local, seasonal ingredients
tips: Must-try the famous Pig Candy bacon - it's a Jackson Hole legend
Great for families with kids - comfortable, welcoming atmosphere
Outdoor patio dining is beautiful in summer under the old trees
Perfect for breakfast or brunch before outdoor adventures
Historic setting adds charm - kids love the log cabin atmosphere

images.alt: Cafe Genevieve historic log cabin with outdoor patio
images.caption: Southern comfort food in a historic 1906 log cabin

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park

specialties: Voted Best Mexican Food in Jackson

content.description: Voted best Mexican food in Jackson Hole multiple years running, Pica's offers authentic Mexican cuisine in a casual, family-friendly atmosphere. This local favorite serves massive portions that often stretch into two meals, making it perfect for families. Featured on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives for their authentic flavors.
highlights: Voted Best Mexican Food and Best Margaritas in Jackson multiple years
Featured on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
Massive burrito portions - often enough for two meals
Homemade tortillas and authentic Mexican preparations
Casual atmosphere perfect for families with kids
tips: Order burritos 'wet' for chipotle enchilada sauce and toppings
Portions are huge - consider sharing or plan for leftovers
Great for takeout - perfect for post-adventure fuel
Try the famous sopes de chicken tinga featured on Food Network
Casual strip-mall location - don't be fooled by appearance, food is exceptional

images.alt: Picas Mexican Taqueria casual dining room with Mexican decor
images.caption: Jackson's favorite authentic Mexican taqueria

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

content.description: Celebrating over 30 years on Jackson's Town Square, Snake River Grill remains the locals' favorite fine dining destination. Founded by Hollywood executive Alan Hirschfield (former CEO of Columbia Pictures and 20th Century Fox), this rustic-elegant establishment showcases the best of New American cuisine in a hunting lodge atmosphere complete with roaring fireplace and white linens.
highlights: 3x James Beard nominated chef Addison Fleming leading the kitchen
300+ wine selection with Wine Spectator Award of Excellence
Famous Steak Tartare Pizza - a cold appetizer with Black Angus NY strip
Private dining room for up to 16 guests
Historic Town Square location with outdoor patio dining
tips: Make reservations well in advance - this is Jackson's busiest fine dining spot
Start at the intimate bar for signature cocktails and spicy bar nuts
Don't miss the Steak Tartare Pizza - it's served cold and is a signature dish
Ask about seasonal specials featuring local farms like Canewater Farm
Expect a bustling, energetic atmosphere - not quiet romantic dining

images.alt: Snake River Grill rustic elegant dining room with fireplace
images.caption: 30+ years of fine dining excellence on Town Square

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

content.description: A modern American steakhouse on Jackson's historic Town Square, Local showcases the passion of chef-owners Will Bradof (Trio) and his wife Jennifer for reviving the craft of in-house butchery. Watch the action on the Town Square while enjoying dry-aged steaks, house-made sausages, and locally-ranched meats in a contemporary western setting.
highlights: In-house butchery with focus on dry-aged steaks and house-made sausages
Locally-ranched meats and wild game alongside fresh seafood
Contemporary western design with Town Square views
Casual vibrant bar atmosphere with 12 local beers on tap
Private dining room overlooking antler arches for up to 30 seated
tips: Perfect spot for lunch burgers or dinner steaks while people-watching
Try the famous bison burger - consistently rated as one of Jackson's best
Extensive wine list pairs perfectly with their dry-aged steaks
Great for groups with both casual bar seating and formal dining room
Ask about their house-made sausages - a specialty of the in-house butchery

images.alt: Local Restaurant & Bar contemporary western dining room
images.caption: Modern steakhouse with Town Square views

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

content.description: Jackson's best kept secret steakhouse features a subterranean speakeasy atmosphere with 16 intimate dining tables surrounding a luminescent bar. Specializing in top 2% USDA Prime steaks that are 28-day wet-aged and butchered in-house, with frequent dry-aged specials and an impressive 1,100-bottle vintage wine collection.
highlights: Top 2% USDA Prime steaks, 28-day wet-aged and butchered in-house
Subterranean speakeasy atmosphere with intimate corner booths
1,100+ vintage wine bottles - extensive collection
Frequent dry-aged steak specials
Luminescent bar perfect for craft cocktails and whiskey sours
tips: Make reservations well in advance - locals call this 'Jackson's best kept secret'
Ask about the dry-aged steak specials - they appear frequently
Cozy corner booths are perfect for intimate dinners
Excellent whiskey selection to pair with your steak
More intimate and quiet than other Jackson steakhouses

images.alt: White Buffalo Club subterranean dining room with luminescent bar
images.caption: Jackson's intimate steakhouse speakeasy

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

content.description: Part of the acclaimed Fine Dining Restaurant Group, The Kitchen provides a refined yet casual dining experience featuring modern American cuisine with Asian influences. With a commitment to simplicity and clean presentation, this restaurant showcases fresh fish, seasonal meats, and comforting dishes with artful presentation.
highlights: Part of Fine Dining Restaurant Group's collection of award-winning restaurants
Modern American cuisine with subtle Asian influences
Emphasis on fresh fish and seasonal ingredients
Clean, uncomplicated presentation with exquisite flavors
More casual atmosphere than typical Jackson fine dining
tips: Great option for those wanting fine dining quality in a more relaxed setting
Ask about the fresh fish specials - they're a restaurant specialty
Asian-influenced dishes offer unique flavors not found elsewhere in Jackson
Good choice for families who want upscale food without stuffy atmosphere
Part of restaurant group that includes Bin22 and The Bistro

images.alt: The Kitchen modern American dining room
images.caption: Refined casual dining with Asian influences

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

content.description: Set in a charming historic house near Miller Park, The Blue Lion has been a local's favorite fine dining destination since 1976. This intimate restaurant offers nearly 50 years of culinary excellence, featuring their legendary herb-crusted rack of lamb, wild game options, and seasonal local dishes in a romantic historic setting.
highlights: Operating since 1976 - nearly 50 years of fine dining tradition
Set in a charming historic house for intimate dining
Famous herb-crusted rack of lamb - the most popular menu item
Diverse chef-driven menu with game, fish, and seasonal specialties
House-crafted cocktails and extensive wine list
tips: The herb-crusted rack of lamb is legendary - definitely try it
Historic house setting makes this perfect for romantic dinners
Off the beaten path near Miller Park - quieter than Town Square options
Nearly 50 years of operation means they've perfected their craft
Great choice for special occasions and celebrations

images.alt: The Blue Lion historic house exterior with mountain views
images.caption: Historic fine dining since 1976

location.distanceFromPark: 12 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

content.description: A Jackson Hole institution since 1982, Nora's Fish Creek Inn is where locals flock for authentic Wyoming breakfast. This rustic log cabin in Wilson received the prestigious James Beard Award in 2012 and was featured on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. Famous for huevos rancheros that have earned legendary status among locals and visitors alike.
highlights: James Beard Award winner (2012) - recognized as an American Classic
Featured on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
Voted 'Best Breakfast in Jackson Hole' multiple years running
Legendary huevos rancheros with tangy green sauce and broiled jack cheese
Historic log cabin setting - originally the local post office and general store
tips: Must-try the famous huevos rancheros - they're legendary for a reason
Banana bread French toast is what Guy Fieri called a 'breakfast avalanche'
Located in Wilson - 15 minutes from Jackson, worth the drive to avoid tourist crowds
Expect a wait during peak times - locals line up for good reason
Service is relaxed pace - approach with patience, especially on weekends

images.alt: Nora's Fish Creek Inn rustic log cabin exterior in Wilson
images.caption: James Beard Award-winning local institution since 1982

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

dining.reservations: no reservations - first come, first served

content.description: This French-inspired bakery and café looks like it jumped straight off a Pinterest board with its whitewashed space and artisan breads. Founded by husband-and-wife team Kevin and Ali Cohane, Persephone uses old world fermentation techniques and stone hearth baking to create authentic French pastries and breads using the highest quality ingredients.
highlights: Featured as 'Most Beautiful Coffee Shop in Wyoming' by national media
Old world fermentation techniques with stone hearth baking
Premium Intelligentsia Coffee and artisan espresso drinks
Multiple locations: Downtown Jackson and Wilson (Westbank)
Seasonal breakfast menu with locally-sourced ingredients
tips: Arrive early - extremely popular and lines can be long
Try the quiche - consistently rated as some of the best ever tasted
Outdoor seating available in summer months
Wilson location (Westbank) is larger and less crowded
Instagram-worthy setting - perfect for photos

images.alt: Persephone Bakery French-style café interior with pastry display
images.caption: Artisan French bakery with old world techniques

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

experience.atmosphere: Casual Local Gathering Place, Historic Charm

content.description: A Jackson Hole institution since 1975, The Bunnery started as a bakery in a small log cabin that was once a blacksmith shop. This local favorite is famous for its OSM (Oats, Sunflower, and Millet) recipe used in pancakes, waffles, and breads - a unique blend you'll find nowhere else. Named 'Best Diner in Wyoming' by MSNBC.
highlights: Operating since 1975 - 50 years of Jackson Hole breakfast tradition
Famous OSM (Oats, Sunflower, Millet) pancakes and breads - signature recipe
Named 'Best Diner in Wyoming' by MSNBC
Fresh-squeezed orange juice and Starbucks bottomless coffee
Take-home options: OSM granola, pancake mixes, and baked goods
tips: Must-try the OSM pancakes - they're what The Bunnery is famous for
Half-block north of Town Square - easy to find
Great bakery counter for take-home treats and mixes
Summer outdoor seating on covered terrace
Popular with locals - arrive early to avoid waits

images.alt: The Bunnery Bakery Restaurant historic interior with bakery counter
images.caption: 50 years of OSM pancakes and fresh-baked traditions

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

content.description: A popular local coffee roaster near Town Square, Snake River Roasting Company offers award-winning coffees that capture the essence of Wyoming. This female-led team is dedicated to crafting high-quality coffee roasts in a modern, vibrant atmosphere with stylish decor and an upstairs loft area for relaxed seating.
highlights: Award-winning local coffee roaster capturing Wyoming's essence
Female-led team dedicated to high-quality coffee crafting
Modern vibrant atmosphere with upstairs loft seating area
Food menu prepared by Provisions - beyond typical coffee shop fare
Near Town Square location with convenient parking
tips: Perfect for quick breakfast before outdoor adventures
Upstairs loft area provides quieter seating option
Local roasting means fresher coffee than chain alternatives
Great grab-and-go option for park visits
Support local, female-led business with award-winning products

images.alt: Snake River Roasting Company modern coffee shop interior
images.caption: Award-winning local coffee roastery near Town Square

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

content.description: Voted best pizza in Jackson Hole since 2011, Pinky G's brings authentic New York-style hand-tossed pizza to Wyoming. Featured three times on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, this casual pizzeria under the Pink Garter Theater serves huge slices until 2am, making it the perfect late-night spot after exploring Town Square.
highlights: Voted Best Pizza in Jackson Hole since 2011 by locals
Featured 3 times on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
Famous $8 lunch special - giant slice, salad, and soda
Open until 2am - latest dining option in Jackson
Live music stage with local artists performing regularly
tips: Try the Abe Froman (Sausage King of Chicago) - spicy Italian sausage specialty
Best deal: $8 lunch special includes huge slice, salad, and soda
Located under Pink Garter Theater - follow the amazing pizza aroma
Open latest in town (2am) - perfect for après-ski or late night cravings
Cornhole boards outside add to the casual, fun atmosphere

images.alt: Pinky G's Pizzeria casual dining room with live music stage
images.caption: New York-style pizza and late-night vibes since 2011

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

content.description: Family-owned and Texas-grown, Liberty Burger reinvents the all-American hamburger with never-frozen chuck, brisket, and tenderloin. Their motto 'Give me liberty or let me starve' reflects their commitment to quality sourcing, local bakeries, and responsible meat sources - proving that doing things right is worth it.
highlights: Never-frozen premium beef: chuck, brisket, and tenderloin blend
Family-owned Texas operation with Wyoming values
Monthly specialty burger featuring seasonal ingredients
Local bakeries using only American-grown ingredients
Environmental responsibility and social contribution focus
tips: Try the bison burger - locals highly recommend it over beef
The Nooner with ham and hash browns is a unique breakfast-burger hybrid
Monthly specialty burgers offer creative seasonal combinations
Quality ingredients make this worth the slightly higher price
Quick service perfect for refueling between outdoor activities

images.alt: Liberty Burger casual dining interior with Western touches
images.caption: Texas-grown quality meets Wyoming values

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

experience.atmosphere: Authentic Bagel Shop, East Coast Tradition

content.description: Celebrating 35 years of serving authentic bagels boiled and baked in the East Coast tradition since 1990. Pearl Street Bagels makes their dough on-site and serves bagels fresh throughout the day, never toasted - operating on the philosophy that fresh bagels are better than toasted ones.
highlights: 35 years of authentic East Coast bagel tradition since 1990
14 varieties of bagels boiled and baked fresh daily
Homemade cream cheeses including unique flavors
Two locations: downtown Jackson and Wilson
Voted locals' favorite coffee shop multiple years
tips: Ask which bagels are hot out of the oven when you arrive
Everything bagel with veggie cream cheese is a local favorite
Perfect grab-and-go option for hiking in Grand Teton
Try the sun-dried tomato olive cream cheese for something special
Wilson location is larger and less crowded than downtown

images.alt: Pearl Street Bagels shop interior with bagel display
images.caption: 35 years of authentic East Coast bagel tradition

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

content.description: Voted Best Coffee Shop in Wyoming by Business Insider, Cowboy Coffee has been serving Jackson Hole with strong, bold, fresh-roasted coffee for over 20 years. This Western-themed coffee shop on Town Square features local art, comfortable couches, and the famous signature Buffalo Chili.
highlights: Voted Best Coffee Shop in Wyoming by Business Insider
20+ years serving fresh-roasted coffee in Jackson Hole
Located right on Town Square - prime location
Rotating local art gallery on the walls
Famous signature Buffalo Chili unique to Wyoming
tips: Try the Granger breakfast sandwich - it's a local's favorite
Opens at 6am - perfect for early morning adventures
Comfortable couches make it great for reading or working
Buy a bag of coffee beans to take home from your travels
Owners Pete and Rob are often there brewing your coffee

images.alt: Cowboy Coffee Co. rustic interior with local art and comfortable seating
images.caption: Wyoming's best coffee shop for over 20 years

location.distanceFromPark: 6 miles to Grand Teton National Park entrance

specialties: Thai, Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Indian Dishes

content.description: From the minds behind Teton Thai, Teton Tiger offers fresh, bright, bold Pan-Asian cuisine in the mountains of Wyoming. This modern restaurant features dishes ranging from Thai to Chinese to Korean to Indian, all incorporating local ingredients with stylish bar seating and an energetic atmosphere.
highlights: From the creators of acclaimed Teton Thai restaurant
Pan-Asian menu spanning Thai, Chinese, Korean, Japanese, and Indian
Stylish modern interior with large booths for groups
Expertly crafted cocktail program with inventive drinks
Live music and energetic atmosphere on select nights
tips: Try the tikka curry and pad Thai - frequently mentioned favorites
Cocktails are exceptional - some say best margaritas in Jackson
Stylish interior makes this perfect for date nights
Large booths accommodate groups well
Check Instagram @tetontiger for daily specials and deals

images.alt: Teton Tiger modern Asian fusion restaurant interior with stylish bar
images.caption: Pan-Asian fusion with mountain flair

location.distanceFromPark: 3 miles

content.description: Inspired by Tuscan wine experiences, Bin22 combines the sophisticated energy of New York City with Italian countryside elegance. This intimate wine bar and tapas restaurant features an extensive bottle shop where guests can select wines to enjoy at their table with no corkage fee.
highlights: #1 rated restaurant on TripAdvisor
Over 300 wines available
House-made fresh mozzarella
European-style communal tables
Adjacent wine shop with expert sommeliers
tips: No reservations - arrive early for best seating
Try the house-pulled mozzarella with toppings
Portions are large - order 1 tapa per person initially
Browse the wine shop and take bottles to your table
Outdoor deck available for pleasant weather

images.alt: Bin22 wine bar interior with warm wood surroundings
images.caption: Sophisticated wine bar experience in downtown Jackson

location.address: 7680 Granite Loop Road, Teton Village, WY 83025

dining.cuisine: Elevated American Pub by Chef Michael Mina

content.description: Located at the Four Seasons in Teton Village, The Handle Bar offers elevated pub fare by Chef Michael Mina with stunning views of Rendezvous Mountain. This contemporary American pub features a 30-seat center bar, cozy booths, and an expansive heated terrace.
highlights: Chef Michael Mina concept
Jaw-dropping mountain views
Happy hour 3-5pm
30-seat center bar
Heated outdoor terrace with fire features
tips: Book reservations for prime dining times
Try the signature Wyo Smash cocktail
Elk chili is a must-try local favorite
Arrive early for patio seats with mountain views
Beer served in 33oz boots for groups

images.caption: Elevated après-ski dining with Teton Range views

dining.cuisine: Creative Modern American with Asian & Mediterranean Influences

experience.atmosphere: Trendy, Creative, Mountain Views of Snow King

content.description: Gather offers creative modern American cuisine with bold Asian and Mediterranean influences. This women-owned establishment features a trendy cocktail bar atmosphere with Snow King Mountain views and is consistently rated as one of Jackson's top restaurants.
highlights: Women-owned establishment
Creative fusion menu
Mountain views of Snow King
Extensive craft cocktail menu
Customer-influenced menu development
tips: Book reservations well in advance
Elk bolognese is the signature dish locals rave about
Happy hour available at 5pm at the bar
Try the Tuesday Tastings at 2pm with chef and owner
Outdoor seating available with mountain views
